newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper called to open off 0.30 to 0.40 cent.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper called to open off 0.30 to 0.40 cent.

text.p: COMEX copper futures were called to open down 0.30 to 0.40 cent per pound Friday, as LME three months fell in overnight trading, vulnerable to profit-taking and booksquaring ahead of the long weekend on both sides of the Atlantic.
LME stocks fell 1,325 tonnes Friday to 137,675 tonnes.
COMEX stocks on Thursday rose 34 short tons to 39,407 short tons.
On overnight ACCESS COMEX July copper was traded 118.85 to 118.20 cents, compared with Thursday's close of 118.95 cents.
The LME backwardation was $83/$85, barely changed from Thursday.
COMEX copper trading ends at 1300 EDT Friday and the exchange is closed Monday for Memorial Day. LME is also closed Monday.
